docs.snippet: The first trip to Europe for Yankees pitcher Phil Hughes included a harrowing and interesting trip to an English soccer game in Manchester....
docs.lead_paragraph: The first trip to Europe for Yankees pitcher Phil Hughes included a harrowing and interesting trip to an English soccer game in Manchester.
docs.abstract: New York Yankees pitcher Phil Hughes is shocked by the volatile crowd at Manchester City soccer club's Etihad Stadium, which he visited on three-week European vacation; decided to buy tickets in the visitors' end of the stadium because of his endorsement of Under Armour, athletic apparel manufacturer that also supplies Tottenham Hotspur with its gear.

headline.seo: For Yankees’ Hughes, a European Vacation With an Edge
headline.main: As Tourist, Hughes Got an Earful of England
headline.print_headline: As Tourist, Hughes Got An Earful of England

docs.snippet:
Consistent fourth-place finishes by the Mets are not helping finances at Citi Field.
   
The ballpark’s latest financial statements show some of the effects of faltering attendance. Last season, the Mets averaged 28,035 a game, down...
docs.lead_paragraph:
Consistent fourth-place finishes by the Mets are not helping finances at Citi Field.
 
The ballpark’s latest financial statements show some of the effects of faltering attendance. Last season, the Mets averaged 28,035 a game, down nearly 7 percent from the 2011 season.
docs.abstract: New York Mets revenue is down at Citi Field as team fails to draw large crowds for a third consecutive year. (M)0

headline.main: Attendance and Revenue Fall at Citi Field

docs.lead_paragraph: The Mets seek a second team to share their spring training facility in Port St. Lucie, Florida, because it would generate more revenue and ensure another team does not depart the region.
docs.abstract: New York Mets seek second team to share their spring training facility in Port St Lucie, Fla, because it would generate more revenue and ensure that at least one other team will stay in the area.

docs.lead_paragraph: With the opening of baseball museums at several stadiums in the past decade or so, many teams have employees who work as historians and curators.
docs.abstract: Baseball museums at stadiums across the country provide opportunity for fans to connect with their team's past; several teams have employees who work as historians and curators, who cover the selection of artifacts and photographs for display.

11:10 p.m. | Updated 

 
TAMPA, Fla. — Mark Teixeira injured his wrist while working out with the United States team Tuesday in Arizona ahead of the World Baseball Classic, leaving the Yankees worried about his status.
docs.abstract: New York Yankees first baseman Mark Teixeira strains wrist during batting practice at World Baseball Classic. (M)
